alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 2:01PM MST until March 16 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Flagstaff AZ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Cornville affecting Yavapai County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Oak Creek...including Sedona, Cornville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO THURSDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Cornville. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flooding of lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 9.0 feet, Hiking trails along banks of creek affected. Portions of residential yards flooded. At 12.0 feet, Significant flooding of RV park near Page Springs Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM MST Tuesday the stage was 4.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late Wednesday morning and reach a maximum value of 13.7 feet late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.3 feet on 02/15/2019. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Oak Creek Cornvill 8.0 4.7 Tue 1 pm MST 8.0 7.5 5.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon.
